author: mark
title: Cardano Hackathon Seasons
description: A cadência atual do fundo Catalyst e a estrutura de propostas não incentiva a criação rápida pró-ativa e de ferramentas, produtos ou serviços.

f6_assessments.q0: Well run hackathons are definitely a great way to quickly fund the development of small projects. In the detailed plan it states these would target blockchain more widely, I would say that if Catalyst is funding this, it should be Cardano focused, though could be bridge to other chains etc. The goals of the plan are a lot bigger than the initial funding requested. It's not clear the proposer has a plan to achieve this.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer claims to be a Director of engineering and to have run hackathons, It would be good to have some evidence provided of this (LinkedIn profile?).
The funding request is only for $25,000 which will cover 1 hackathon, though the proposal is much bigger than this. It would be good to see a more detailed plan on where the large sponsorship money will come from ($500,000 world finals?) and evidence the proposer has the agility to source this. The agility to pull off a plan like this really does rely on the proposers experience and network. He may have this, however evidence has not been provided.
f6_assessments.q2:
The prosper has provided a simple timeline for the first hackathon which is what the budget covers. It is thus easy to audit if this hackathon is held. It would be good to have a goal on how many participants/teams will register and compete. Given this challenge is about funding projects, how is the impact of the products made during the hackathon to be measured. Will you track their further progress to becoming a commercial or open source project and the impacts it has on the community. 
the later success at 6 and 12 months is defined again as holding the hackathon. It would be good to see some goals and metrics for measuring the impacts of the hackathons rather than just the fact that the occurred.

f6_assessments.q0: Starting to build a project already within an hackatlon challenge will speed up idea generating and contribution to the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has previous experience with this type of activity. However, so far there's no sponsorship found so it's unclear if the goal of reaching a final prize for the hackatlon of half million dollar will be feasible. It might be doable with the help of an entry fee put by each team at the start of the competition at the regional phases.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided goes through all the key elements of the challenge metrics. Also the timeline and budget breakdown proposed are realistic and well defined

f6_assessments.q0: The author proposes to organize hackathons with a cash prize for winners to promote participation of solo persons or teams to build an MVP, receive feedback and possibly receive the prize. As the hackathon will be of 1 or 2 week duration, the delivery of funds would be faster than the actual funding mechanism. In that condition, this proposal fits within the challenge goal. However my concern is that hackathons are oriented to the dev community and may leave behind other types of projects. Anyway, the project includes metrics and states how scalability will be achieved.
f6_assessments.q1: The author of the proposal claims that as a Director of Engineering he ran multiple hackathons. Unfortunately he did not provide more references and he neither explained how he will form a team to develop all the tasks needed. If there is a concern on this proposal is the lack of information on how he wel form a team and compensate for its duties. Beside that, the proposal gives details of timelines, deliverables and a breakdown of the total budget. Additionally, there's a well defined plan and how a hackathon should be organized.
f6_assessments.q2: The project execution consists of organizing the hackathons, and the proposal provides a well defined goal to achieve in the short and medium term. Scalability is also presented and it is reasonable. Metrics and KPI were not provided, even though the author clearly states that all events will be publicly available and recorded, giving confidence that the progress can easily be audited as well as the allocation of funds.

f6_assessments.q0: A quarterly cadence is not faster then the current Catalyst model. therefore, the proposal does not effectively address the brief goal and intent to: "Increasing the speed of funding is critically important to allow important projects to move rapidly from volunteers to paid professionals. While volunteerism is strong in our community (and a strength), the ability to pay people for their time will accelerate and dramatically improve the time and energy people will be able to devote to Catalyst."
f6_assessments.q1: As a team lead, the proposer is competent in organizing and executing the proposal concept: " I ran multiple internal Hackathons to promote innovation, community, and culture building."
f6_assessments.q2:
Success is described, KPIs, milestones, action plans, roadmap are aligned, 
specific, measurable, auditable, and time
 fenced, therefore the information is sufficient to audit success and progress towards it.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge has been successfully addressed as the proposed solution allows for hackathons that have a short duration, can be run often and allow for dispersal of funds to smart motivated individuals/ teams while the main catalyst competitions can have a much longer duration and can be for complete ideas. This should (at least in theory) allow for smart and motivated engineers to be enticed to join the Cardano ecosystem in a fun and engaging way bringing more talent into the Cardano (which can never be a bad thing :) )
f6_assessments.q1: Firstly the claims of the experience cannot be verified a link to the proposers LinkedIn or websites would go a long way. Secondly, and more concerningly the budgeting for this project is inadequate there is a requested sum of $25,000. $3000 will be used to set up a website a bit high for a website but that's fine. $4000 for "Tools and Materials" please specify what this would entail as this could mean almost anything. $3000 for "Regional 1 Venue hire & catering" is this the ideal use of funds? Is the first hackathon not better to be completely online ? $15000 for the prize pool this is also understandable as more prize money would attract more competitors. However, what the budgeting does not entail is the payment of staff (marketers, help running the competitions ...etc), judges (perhaps this is free...?), legal cost/setting up the legal framework required such an event should not be hosted with personal liability ? What if someone is hurt during the hackathon then the organiser would be personally liable! Hence with more than half of the money being put aside for the prize pool, this would not be enough funds to cover everything else required.
f6_assessments.q2: The success metrics of this proppsal have been clearly defined however this project is lacking serverly in the auditability department as mentioned previous the proposer has mentioned that they are a enjineerer however no LinkedIn or website has been provided. Further more no details of how the auiditng could take place has been provided. Lastly in the proposal the questions "How Accountable is this proposal?" was raised where the proposer awnsered "I have solicited the challenge team for some clarification on these questions" implying the proposer did not understand how to show the proposals auditability, Fair enough however I must review the proposal as complete and thus I would recommend to reapply when these questions can be answered.

f6_assessments.q0: The creation of a regional virtual hackathon series would bolster the catalyst process with a more streamlined funding vehicle for development teams building in Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan included in the challenge and timeline give the CA sufficient detail into the proposer's implementation plan. The team's relevant experience as Director of Engineering also checks the box for a technical background.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal plan, roadmap and the implementation steps included in this proposal are sufficient to audit the progress.

solution: Temporada trimestral da Hackathon, que tem competições locais e regionais com prêmios em dinheiro, cujos vencedores participam da final da temporada
experience: Como Diretor de Engenharia, dirigi várias Hackathons internas para promover a inovação, a comunidade e a construção da cultura.
